frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').

A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   ' Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively conveys some of South Africa 's problems .
These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an Agent, usually with regard to another person (the Controllee) and often with regard to a particular Issue.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
frameExamples: She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
Court says judge too <t>lenient</t> in rape case.INI
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
Mo <t>dodged</t>  the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.

The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This role is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Agent'>The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name='Agent'>school</fex>.

The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control.  The Controlled_entity generally occurs in a PP Complement.
Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name='Controlled_entity'>with their grandchildren</fex>.
The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name='Controlling_act'>in dealing with the offender</fex>.

The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation.  Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name='Issue'>about pollution control</fex>.

A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient.  Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name='Medium'>rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name='Medium'>Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>.
The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
The <fen>Dodger</fen> acts to avoid an oncoming <fen>Bad_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Bad_entity</fen> is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the dodging occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the dodging occurs.
listRoleExamples: No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
<fex>Nobody</fex> seems to be able to get the idea through to her that she needs a job!!!!

According to Masztalics, a good teacher uses experiments to get the point across
<fex>to the class</fex>.
He tried to get through to his wife <fex>that the debt he's taken on buying stocks poses no risk</fex>.
<fex>The article</fex> conveys Mr. Handley's disrespect for those who disagree with him.
Greenspan got his point across <fex>yesterday</fex> that a measured pace of rate hikes is still the plan.
I like to think he quaked under my authoritarian <fex>glare</fex>.
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.
<fex>Mo</fex> dodged the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mo dodged <fex> the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust</fex>.
